messages: f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (14:27): maybe we could add a subtitle that mentions XHTML
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:28): tweaking the title is a total bikeshed
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (14:29): Tweaking the title isn't; arguing extensively about tweaking the title is
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (14:29): I know, but cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 has a point
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:29): agreed on both counts
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:30): so if we prepend "(X)" can we also drop the space? :-)
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (14:31): We'd have to have a new survey to agree on the new name
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:31): right: bikeshed
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:37): the last few lines of cnn.com front page are interesting
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:38): they have a <style> in <noscript> at the end of the page
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:38): works wonders on JS disabled incremental rendering, I assume
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (14:40): <script language="JavaScript"><!--
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (14:40): if(navigator.appVersion.indexOf('MSIE')>=0)document.write(unescape('%3C')+'\!-'+'-')
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (14:41): does some version of ie load images in <noscript>s? or why would they include that script?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:41): 3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2: suppose there was an app for inspecting a list of top sites for spec conformance, what should it output?

b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:44): (it shouldn't be too hard to modify the current whattf.org unit test driver into a single-threaded app that validated a list of HTTP resources sequentially and printed something out)
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:45): now that the div content model is more permissive, my bet is that the top error will be:
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:45): Bad value content-type for attribute http-equiv on element meta.
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:45): Attribute language not allowed on element script at this point.
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (14:46): duplicate id
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:47): oh yeah, bogus & will be common

b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:47): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: Presumably it should print (at least) the number/fraction of pages with one or more of each error and the median number per page of each error
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:47): I think we should continue to treat bogus & as an error, though
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:47): s/number/number per page/
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:48): (that's the final occurence of "number")
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:48): No, wait, I'm not making any sense
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:50): I wonder if tallying tokenizer/tree builder/validator errors separately were worthwhile

cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (15:00): when taking html input in a webapp (e.g. blog comments), it would be reasonable to silently allow tokenizer/tree builder errors (just make it correct with html5lib) but then reject validation errors
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:01): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0: I agree. I meant the case of surveying top sites, though
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:09): December content model changes now deployed at Validator.nu except for the <style scoped> issues I raised on list
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:09): (still in time considering my "later this week" assessment earliel :-)
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:18): hmm. looks like I broke SVG integration in the process...
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:24): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: SVG integration now restored
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (15:30): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: s/you code/your code/ http:/ b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9.iki.fi/producing-xml/#dontprint
